newsitem.title: USA: Knight-Ridder buys papers from ABC.
newsitem.headline: Knight-Ridder buys papers from ABC.

text.p: Knight-Ridder Inc said on Friday it has completed the previously announced acquisition of four newspapers owned by Walt Disney Co's ABC Inc for $1.65 billion.

The newspapers are The Kansas City Star, the Fort Worth and Arlington Star-Telegrams, the Belleville (Ill.) News- Democrat, and The Times Leader in Wilkes-Barre, Pa., the companies said in a joint statement.
Also, Knight-Ridder reiterated its previously announced plans to repurchase a minimum of 15 million common shares of its own stock.

Knight Ridder said the proposed deals will result in 10 percent dilution to Knight-Ridder earnings during the first 12 months following closing, minimal dilution during the second 12 months and will be accretive to earnings in the third year.

The entire dilution in 1997 is caused by the amortization of goodwill from the transaction, said Knight Ridder, a publisher of 35 daily newspapers. The $1.65 billion purchase price is less than 11 times anticipated cash flows for 1997, the company said.
